messageBody:
On Thu, 25 Jan 2001, Kevin Bourrillion wrote:

> Yes, but the question is, how would you do it automatically, from within the
> JVM?

Well, there's a signal() routine in the OS which will do it. The JVM
would need to have a low-level routine sitting on a timer or something,
checking to see if the app is deadlocked or not.

JBuilder Enterprise has deadlock detection in its debugger, so it seems
possible to deal with the situation.

> If it's deadlock, it's not such a problem, since the thread states will be
> preserved indefinitely until you come in in the morning to hit CTRL-\. But
> if it's another type of failure you want to record that information right
> away. Right?
